title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

With relatively higher real interest rates in Europe (relatively lower real interest rates in the U.S.) there will be fewer purchases (less demand) for U.S. financial assets.
descriptions:
No points earned.

With relatively higher real interest rates in Europe (relatively lower real interest rates in the U.S.) there will be fewer purchases (less demand) for U.S. financial assets.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

With relatively higher real interest rates in Europe (relatively lower real interest rates in the U.S.) there will be fewer purchases (less demand) for U.S. financial assets.

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

The dollar depreciates because of the reduced demand for U.S. dollars (or increased supply of dollars to buy EUROs).

Must have dollar depreciation linked to the decreased demand for $ (or increased supply of dollars to buy EUROs). (NO Assertions Accepted)
descriptions:
No point earned.

The dollar depreciates because of the reduced demand for U.S. dollars (or increased supply of dollars to buy EUROs).

Must have dollar depreciation linked to the decreased demand for $ (or increased supply of dollars to buy EUROs). (NO Assertions Accepted)

Earns 1 of 1 point.

The dollar depreciates because of the reduced demand for U.S. dollars (or increased supply of dollars to buy EUROs).

Must have dollar depreciation linked to the decreased demand for $ (or increased supply of dollars to buy EUROs). (NO Assertions Accepted)

title: Part c.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Even if (b) is incorrect, students may earn points in (c) and (d) for consistency.

U.S. exports increase, because they are now less expensive to foreigners.

  • Must give an explanation beyond the “change in the value of the dollar”

  • Explanation must reflect the relative price effect caused by the change in the value of the dollar. Acceptable arguments include:

    • American goods have become relatively inexpensive.

    • American goods cost less than European goods.

    • American goods are relatively more affordable than European goods.

    • American goods are cheaper than European goods.

  • Explanations not accepted:

    • Weak currency

    • Depreciated dollar
descriptions:

title: Part d.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

Even if (b) is incorrect, students may earn points in (c) and (d) for consistency.

U.S. imports decrease, because foreign goods are now more expensive.

  • Must give an explanation beyond the “change in the value of the dollar”

  • Explanation must reflect the relative price effect caused by the change in the value of the dollar. Acceptable arguments include:

    • European goods have become relatively more expensive.

    • European goods now cost more than American goods.

    • European goods are now relatively less affordable than American goods.

    • American goods are cheaper than European goods.

  • Explanations not accepted:

    • Weak currency

    • Depreciated dollar
